SEARCH
Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class Median

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.Median
public final class Median extends Object
The Median class is a utility class that provides methods for calculating the median of various types of data. It includes methods for calculating the median of arrays and collections of various types, including integers, longs, doubles, and objects. This class is final and cannot be instantiated.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static Pair<Byte,u.OptionalByte>
    of(byte... a)
    Returns a Pair with left is the (length / 2 + 1) largest value, and the right is the (length / 2) largest value if the length of array is even.
    static Pair<Byte,u.OptionalByte>
    of(byte[] a, int fromIndex, int toIndex)
    Returns a Pair with left as the sizeOfRange / 2 + 1 largest value in the given range, and the right as the sizeOfRange / 2 largest value if the size of the given range is even.

      • of(int[])

    • of

      public static Pair<Character,u.OptionalChar> of(char[] a, int fromIndex, int toIndex) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns a Pair with left as the sizeOfRange / 2 + 1 largest value in the given range, and the right as the sizeOfRange / 2 largest value if the size of the given range is even.
      Parameters:
      a - the array of characters to find the median from.
      fromIndex - the starting index (inclusive) of the range to consider.
      toIndex - the ending index (exclusive) of the range to consider.
      Returns:
      a Pair containing the median value and an optional second median value if the size of the given range is even.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified range is out of bounds.
      See Also:
      • of(int[])

    • of

      @SafeVarargs public static Pair<Integer,u.OptionalInt> of(int... a) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a Pair with left is the (length / 2 + 1) largest value, and the right is the (length / 2) largest value if the length of array is even.
      The input array don't need to be sorted. in other words, there is no benefit even if the array is sorted. 
       
 Median.of(1); // -> [1, OptionalInt[]]
 Median.of(1, 3); // -> [1, 3]
 Median.of(1, 3, 5); // -> [3, OptionalInt[]]

 Median.of(1, 1); // -> [1, 1]
 Median.of(1, 1, 3); // -> [1, OptionalInt[]]
 Median.of(1, 1, 3, 5); // -> [1, 3]
 Median.of(1, 1, 1, 3, 5); // -> [1, OptionalInt[]]
 Median.of(1, 1, 1, 3, 3, 5); // -> [1, 3]
 Median.of(1, 1, 1, 3, 3, 3, 5); // -> [3, OptionalInt[]]
      Parameters:
      a -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified Array is null or empty.
      See Also:
      • N.median(int[])

    • of

      public static Pair<Integer,u.OptionalInt> of(int[] a, int fromIndex, int toIndex) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns a Pair with left as the sizeOfRange / 2 + 1 largest value in the given range, and the right as the sizeOfRange / 2 largest value if the size of the given range is even.
      Parameters:

      fromIndex - the starting index (inclusive) of the range to consider.
      toIndex - the ending index (exclusive) of the range to consider.
      Returns:
      a Pair containing the median value and an optional second median value if the size of the given range is even.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified range is out of bounds.

    • of

      public static <T> Pair<T,u.Nullable<T>> of(T[] a, int fromIndex, int toIndex, Comparator<? super T> cmp) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns a Pair with left as the sizeOfRange / 2 + 1 largest value in the given range, and the right as the sizeOfRange / 2 largest value if the size of the given range is even.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the array.
      Parameters:
      a - the array of elements to find the median from.
      fromIndex - the starting index (inclusive) of the range to consider.
      toIndex - the ending index (exclusive) of the range to consider.
      cmp - the comparator to determine the order of the elements.
      Returns:
      a Pair containing the median value and an optional second median value if the size of the given range is even.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified range is out of bounds.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is null or empty.
      See Also:
